node.title: France signs $26 billion warplane deal with the United Arab Emirates
node.alt: Two men smile and shake hands
node.description: The deal will provide the UAE with new Rafale warplanes, in France's largest-ever export weapons contract.
node.content:
["France has announced the signing\u00a0of a $25.6 billion armaments mega-contract for the sale of 80 of its Rafale warplanes to the United Arab Emirates.", "The French Defence Ministry said the deal was France's largest-ever weapons contract for export.", "The deal offers a shot in the arm for France's defence industry after the collapse of a $93\u00a0billion contract for Australia to buy 12 French submarines.", "French President Emmanuel Macron is in the Emirates on the first stop of a two-day visit to the Persian Gulf.", "There was no immediate confirmation of the deal from Emirati officials.", "Manufacturer Dassault Aviation said the UAE was buying the upgraded F4 version of its multi-role combat aircraft.", "That will make the Emirates Air Force the first user\u00a0of the Rafale F4 outside\u00a0France, it said.", "Dassault Aviation boss Eric Trappier called the sale \"a French success story\" and \"excellent news for France and for its aeronautical industry\".", "Mr Macron's keen interest in forging personal relationships with leaders like Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, the Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi, and his counterpart in Saudi Arabia, Mohamed bin Salman Al Saud, makes him a welcome guest in the region.", "", "
The UAE deal comes after France lost a $90 billion submarine contract with Australia.(ADF)
", "However, rights groups have criticised both countries for human rights violations.", "France has deep ties to the United Arab Emirates, a federation of seven sheikdoms on the Arabian Peninsula, particularly since the September\u00a011, 2001, attacks.", "France\u00a0opened a naval base in 2009 at Abu Dhabi's Port Zayed.", "French warplanes and personnel are also stationed at Al-Dhafra Air Base, a major facility outside the Emirati capital of Abu Dhabi that's also home to several thousand American troops.", "Months after Mr Macron was elected in 2017, he travelled to the UAE to inaugurate Louvre Abu Dhabi, built under a $1.7\u00a0billion agreement to share the name and art of the world-famous museum in Paris.", "In September, Mr Macron hosted Abu Dhabi's Crown Prince at the historic Chateau de Fontainebleau outside Paris, which was restored in 2019 with a UAE donation of $16 million.", "The UAE and France have become increasingly aligned over a shared mistrust of Islamist political parties across the Middle East, and backed the same side in Libya's civil strife.", "AP"]
